issue.title: gzserver crashes when launched with ssh X-forwarding

content.raw:
Yeah setting `DISPLAY=:0` does work for my use case, but adding that as another argument is an additional argument that either needs to be documented or automated for our deployment. I fell back to logging out and back in without X-forwarding.

We have several applications that are X-Forwarded from cloud instances and this just means that we have to be very careful about documenting where to X-Forward and where not to.

It was surprising to me that it started failing when I changed my login options to add functionality that's unused. This seems like a case that should be able to be caught and gazebo continue to operate like it does when launched via ssh w/o x-forwarding.
